formatted_address: 66 & 68, Jalan Eko Botani 3/2 , Taman Eko Botani, Iskandar Puteri, 79100 Johor Bahru, Johor Darul Ta'zim, Malaysia
name: Rose Cottage Hotel Eco Botanic

reviews.text:
The worst hotel I stayed in JB. First thing enter into room is a strong smoking smell, as in walk in further it smells like musky body odor of a sweaty worker. Aircon barely working, if you turn it to higher fan speed it’s super loud.. the wall papers are stained and torn like a haunted house. The Tv can change channel cannot turn off (had to off the main switch). The fridge was off, unplugged and when you opened it it’s full of mold. The toilet starts to leak when you flush it. No amenities and hand soup just a shower gel mounted on the wall. All the wall plugs are loose, not a single plug can stay on well. I know it’s a budget hotel, but this is barely acceptable.

Saw this place when touring around last trip and decided to give it a try considering it’s quite decent looking outside - oh boy, how wrong we were. Only plus point is the location and the price

Room cleanness 2/5
Towels 1/5 dirty
Air con 1/5 not effective. Changed room twice
Service 0/5 unfriendly and ineffective
Amenities 2/5
Bed 2/5
Bathroom 1/5 small, stains & unventilated
Location 4/5
Advise: go for Airbnb
Will return 0/5. Never
We had request many times to help resolve air con(room temp was 28 degrees).

For such price, I think I can't expect much, however, basic cleanness to the room should not be compromised.

Please, at least change the bed sheet and pillow case after used, it was so smelly and unbearable !
The room is clean and the price is reasonable. The staff is friendly and helpful. Location is good with all kinds of cafe, restaurants.
An excellent hotel near to the Educity. Stayed two nights. The streets in this areas are full of restaurants. There is also a shopping complex nearby.

vicinity: 66 & 68, Jalan Eko Botani 3/2 , Taman Eko Botani, Iskandar Puteri, Johor Bahru
